ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Newbie saga (Long...help?!)
ygData.msgSnippet: Interesting story.  Reminds me of the humor column called Skaterr Gnome on Casters Realm. You ll find that there is an amazing learning curve that happens as
ygData.messageBody:
Interesting story.  Reminds me of the humor column called "Skaterr Gnome" on Casters Realm.
 
You'll find that there is an amazing learning curve that happens as you go along.  It starts with just learning your way around the zones.  You'll find that as you progress you'll keep visiting specific zones repeatedly, and these zones you'll get to know like the back of your hand.  It'll be interesting to hear how your story changes when you start getting higher in level... the type sof questions you will ask then.
 
I can remember when I first started playing EverQuest, the gameplay was very different than it is now.  I started playing at the time The Ruins Of Kunark had just been released.  My first character was a half elf rogue.  I started out in Freeport.  I didn't knwo anything about spells or having to med for mana.  I didn't know anything about needing magical weapons to kill magical creatures.  All I knew were the basics of how to move around and how to set up my hotkeys.  So believe me, the first time I tried to go up against a willowisp using a rusty rapier, I had a big shock.  Another thing I didn't know about was light sources or gamma correction.  As a default gamma isn't set very high in the game and that makes it incredibly difficult to see int he dark, even for races that have infravision.  Then you find out that different light sources have greater ranges.  For example, a fire beetle eye acts as a lightsource but doesnt have as wide a range as a Greater Lightstone.  Then you find out that some armor you can get acts as its own lightsource.  Well as a newbie rogue, I didn't know all that.  So when I found myself at an orc camp in East Commons with no source of light, I had no idea where I was or how I got there.  All I knew was that I was dead before I could move 2 feet.  I thought I'd never get my corpse back!!  Keep in mind, that was back in the day when you didnt get your gear back before level 10 when you died.  Anyway, with the help of a bard I managed to locate my corpse.  Since then, I've learned East Commons so well that's it's now impossible for me to get lost there. 
 
And I think you'll find the same will happen to you.  Just keep running around the zone, try to avoid dying as much as possible, and you'll learn your way around as well as any high level player.
 
 
Incidentally, another learnign curve happens when you go from playing a caster to a non-caster or vice versa.  you can't play the two the same way.  When you've played one type for so long it's a little hard to get used to playing the other type.  So if the first character you create is a paladin, that's a good thing, cause they're highbrids, casters with melee abilities.  Make it easier to transition later on.
 
Wulfric  //  Raido
38 ROG  //  52 DRU
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: armsfullofblessings
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 05, 2004 9:39 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] Newbie saga (Long...help?!)


Hello all,

My name is Peg, and I am glad to have found your e-loop.  I'm one
of
those newbies.  Started about three weeks ago, role playing as
Qaidyanye, (still a 1st level High Elf-Paly) on the Brell Serilis
server.

I have been trying to learn as much as possible from my basic EQ
Gold manual, a set of the Prima Players Guides a couple of sites
online and this loop.  I absolutely love to read about EQ play.  I
can only get on for one extended play and a couple of shorter
sessions a week though, so don't have a lot of intense time online.

(1) I wanted to roleplay and not use any of what is called the
power leveling ...but I'm so unknowledgeable, I think I have
accidentally...?  I found a small mail quest and was talking to a
really high level (59 or so) SK, who for whatever reason deemed to
group me and told me to get on auto-follow.  She got me from
Felwithe to the orc lift at Kelethin.  So cool when you're new.  
Anyhow, up the lift I went.  I found the Bard's Guild Hall, however,
when I went to deliver the 'letter' --- it was no longer in my
inventory...I am certain it was given to me from an NPC character
(Tissleplay.  Its not like I have a lot in inventory yet as you know
with newbies, but the `letter' was gone when I went to 'give'
it to
the Bard.   So I wandered around the treetops for awhile.  I spoke
to a few players, but found nothing to do and was trying to figure
out how I could get back through the forest to Felwithe to do my
basic training points.  As I was walking around through the tree
platforms, from my back came an attack by an orc something or
other...after he struck me the first time I ran to a guard nearby,
but the orc thingy killed me and the guard.  So I 'came back' at the
entrance to Greater Faydark I think.

Very soon after I started walking, a character began talking with
me, and I talked with him for awhile.  He said he was a level six,
he was bald looking and had a green robe of some type on.  He wanted
to 'group', and we went along towards the town center.  He told me
about swimming and I tried that.
Then he told me let's meditate, after sitting for awhile, I went
over to try and talk with an NPC for fishing supplies, when I came
back this group leader guy Summader) was dead.  He didn't come back
very quickly, so I went along.  I found some quest that said if I
collected the bone chips of four skeletons I would be 'richly
rewarded.'  So I went to the outside of Faydark, and Summader was
there again.  I told him of my quest and he said let's go...he had
some sorts of magic spells and used them on a couple of skeletons,
and motioned for me to pick up the loot.  Which I think I did.  Then
this Summader disappeared.  Here I am, level one, innocent little
Paly, drakelings, flying bats, skeletons...twinkling twinks or
something like that all around me...no path in sight.  I start
running; suddenly I see a path, and on the other side what looks
like a stanchion with a book on top of it.  I went over and clicked,
thinking it was some sort of clue etc....and it says 'loading'.  
(2)  Then suddenly I am somewhere else...(I have EQ Gold edition
which includes Everquest Classic, Ruins of Kunark, Shadows of
Luclin, Scars of Velious and Planes of Power.)---so did I 'power up
somewhere?"  Or was this just some sort of portal?  Open ground area
with mostly one story Grecian architecture type buildings...quite a
lot of different races running about. Text is scrolling by fast on
my main window, most of which is peppered with abbreviations I
cannot figure out of course :o)....I turned one corner, and then it
looks like a big party...at least 15 or 20 characters, different
races/species, all slinging magic of some sort or practicing or ? 
I, irl, was at that a little fried from this log-on and all the
activity and not having any inkling where I am, or what is going
on.  I could find hardly anyone who would speak with mea very
busy
place! Finally, a gallant, (sweet) manly-man :0), took a minute to
walk me over to some sort of vertically designed stone and I got
back to Greater Faydark and then camped.  And so that is my
(probably quite boring) saga. 

When I went online the next time, a most helpful Cleric struck up a
conversation with me.  She was very generous with gifts and her
time.  (Unfortunately, I kept getting disconnected 1001 errors.) She
said she gave to me three items  I think leather legging, a vest
or
jacket of some sort, and something else.  She also gave me 107
plat.  The plat showed up on my inventory screen; but I can't
find
the gifts.  She kept trying to tell me to look in my backpack as I
don't have any bags yet.  I have scoured my manual and
guidesI
click on my backpack and see the image of the backpackbut I
don't
know how to `open' it or access the contents.  So I found a
bank and
put my money in, and went out happily hunting truth and injustice as
only a powerful 1st level Paly can doand I actually killed
several
rodents AND a spiderlingAND attacked a skeleton-looking
thing,
ding,I got promoted, now evil Norrath residents are cowering as I
practice my hunting prowess as a Level 2 High Elf Paly

Now what?!  I thought I would try to get some info before going back
on.   I love this, but have absolutely no one irl who is the least
bit interested in any sort of roleplaying type game...or knows
anything about EQ.

In one of the last EQ digests I read, Flaumigevylke said:
"... But I have to say as well that there's characters from every
class I've played with have done the same thing, they don't know how
to play and end up getting the whole group wiped out. Personally I
blame it on them being power leveled and not taking the time to
learn how to really play them or know what their full capabilities
are."


It would be so helpful to all of the newbies reading this, if you
vet's would give us a general overview of the most beneficial trek
toward being a good supportive player by the time we are at higher
levels.  I know skills and training is somewhat different dependent
upon the race and class.  I would love some personal guidance on how
to become a rock solid Paly!  But, general pointers are also helpful
to beginners.  There is a HUGE amount of information. Like, I've
read in all my guides, if you are a level below 10 or so, you should
practice or train your skills any chance you get; and also not to
venture much past where a guard is, that you shouldn't try to kill
even the smaller mobs if there are multiples, etc.   --- so how do I
move up in levels?  I have no inkling yet, how to strategize.  I
know what my main inventory window is, but when I have killed
something and loot it, a different window pops up...does everything
I loot go automatically to my main inventory window, or am I suppose
to access some other sort of window to see the items I am obtaining
towards a quest I am on? Some character said he gave me a 'buff' and
for me to go fight something---that the buff would be good for two
hours.  But how do I confirm something like this; what window do I
go to in order to see what sort of magical help he gave me? 

I swear never to write more than a two paragraph post again, pls
don't kick me off the list for taking up too much space and time! 
Thanks a lot,

Sign me:
Hoping for a lot of help now, so that a few seasons from now I won't
sound so pathetic and I can later help someone else...
Q on Brell Serilis
